conclusion: To determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases, we need to analyze the slopes of their respective velocity-time (v-t) graphs.
Particle A accelerates from t = 0 to t = t0. Particle B accelerates from t = 0 to t = 5t0.
Calculate the acceleration for Particle A: Initial velocity u_A = 0, Final velocity v_A = 2v0 at t = t0, Acceleration a_A = (2v0 - 0) / (t0 - 0) = 2v0/t0.
Calculate the acceleration for Particle B: Initial velocity u_B = 0, Final velocity v_B = v0 at t = 5t0, Acceleration a_B = (v0 - 0) / (5t0 - 0) = v0/5t0.
Determine the ratio of accelerations: Ratio a_A/a_B = (2v0/t0) / (v0/5t0) = 10.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases is 10:1.
